Name: locktype
column6: type of the lockable object: relation, extend, page, tuple, transactionid, object, userlock, or advisory

Name: database
column6: oid of the database in which the object exists, or zero if the object is a shared object, or null if the object is a transaction id

Name: relation
column6: oid of the relation, or null if the object is not a relation or part of a relation

Name: page
column6: page number within the relation, or null if the object is not a tuple or relation page

Name: tuple
column6: tuple number within the page, or null if the object is not a tuple

Name: transactionid
column6: id of a transaction, or null if the object is not a transaction id

Name: classid
column6: oid of the system catalog containing the object, or null if the object is not a general database object

Name: objid
column6: oid of the object within its system catalog, or null if the object is not a general database object

Name: objsubid
column6: for a table column, this is the column number (the classid and objid refer to the table itself). for all other object types, this column is zero. null if the object is not a general database object

Name: transaction
column6: id of the transaction that is holding or awaiting this lock

Name: pid
column6: process id of the server process holding or awaiting this lock. null if the lock is held by a prepared transaction

Name: mode
column6: name of the lock mode held or desired by this process (see section 12.3.1)

Name: granted
column6: true if lock is held, false if lock is awaited
